description: A common, round fruit produced by the tree Malus domestica, cultivated in temperate climates. [from 9th c.]
name: Apple

description: A plant of the species Citrullus lanatus, bearing a melon-like fruit.
name: Watermelon

description:
An evergreen tree of the genus Citrus such as Citrus sinensis.
The fruit of an orange tree; a citrus fruit with a slightly sour flavour.
The colour of a ripe fruit of an orange tree, midway between red and yellow.
name: Orange

description:
An edible fruit produced by the pear tree, similar to an apple but elongated towards the stem.
(also pear tree) A type of fruit tree (Pyrus communis).
The wood of the pear tree.
choke pear (a torture device)
name: Pear

description:
The sweet, usually red, edible fruit of certain plants of the genus Fragaria.
Any plant of the genus Fragaria (that bears such fruit).
A dark pinkish red colour, like that of the fruit; strawberry red.
(rare) Something resembling a strawberry, especially a reddish bruise or birthmark.
name: Strawberry

description: a berry, typically green (classified as white), purple, red, or black, growing in clusters on a grapevine, eaten as fruit, and used in making wine
name: Grape

description: any of several trees producing edible oval fruit having a smooth skin and a single hard stone
name: Plum

description: large evergreen tropical tree cultivated for its large oval fruit
name: Mango

description: sweet edible dark-blue berries of either low-growing or high-growing blueberry plants
name: Blueberry

description: tropical American shrub or small tree having huge deeply palmately cleft leaves and large oblong yellow
name: Papaya

description:
Asian tree having clusters of usually white blossoms and edible fruit resembling the peach;
downy yellow to rosy-colored fruit resembling a small peach
name: Apricot

description: shrub or small tree having flattened globose fruit with very sweet aromatic pulp and thin yellow-orange to flame-orange rind that is loose and easily removed; native to southeastern Asia
name: Mandarin

description: elongated crescent-shaped yellow fruit with soft sweet flesh
name: Banana

description: citrus tree bearing large round edible fruit having a thick yellow rind and juicy somewhat acid pulp
name: Grapefruit

description: yellow oval fruit with juicy acidic flesh
name: Lemon

description: the green acidic fruit of any of various lime trees
name: Lime

description: The pineapple (Ananas comosus) is a tropical plant with an edible fruit and the most economically significant plant in the family Bromeliaceae.
name: Pineapple

description:
a large, tropical, milky-juiced tree, Artocarpus heterophyllus, of the mulberry family, having stiff and glossy green leaves, cultivated for its very large, edible fruit and seeds. 
the fruit of this tree, which may weigh up to 70 pounds (32 kilograms).
name: Jackfruit

description: the fruit of any of various plants of the gourd family, as the muskmelon or watermelon.
name: Melon

description: the large, hard-shelled seed of the coconut palm, lined with a white edible meat, and containing a milky liquid.
name: Coconut

description: Also called alligator pear. a large, usually pear-shaped fruit having green to blackish skin, a single large seed, and soft, light-green pulp, borne by the tropical American tree Persea americana and its variety P. adrymifolia, often eaten raw, especially in salads.
name: Avocado

description: the subacid, juicy, drupaceous fruit of a tree, Prunus persica, of the rose family.
name: Peach

description: Also called Chinese gooseberry. the egg-sized, edible berry of the Chinese gooseberry, having fuzzy brownish skin and slightly tart green flesh.
name: Kiwi

description: the small, round, blackish, edible fruit of a widely cultivated shrub, Ribes nigrum, of the saxifrage family.
name: Blackcurrant

description: the fruit, black or very dark purple when ripe, of certain species of the genus Rubus.
name: Blackberry

description: the fruit of any of various trees belonging to the genus Prunus, of the rose family, consisting of a pulpy, globular drupe enclosing a one-seeded smooth stone.
name: Cherry

description: any tree or shrub belonging to the genus Ficus, of the mulberry family, especially a small tree, F. carica, native to southwestern Asia, bearing a turbinate or pear-shaped fruit that is eaten fresh, preserved, or dried.
name: Fig

description: a small rounded fruit with sweet white scented flesh, a large central stone, and a thin rough skin.
name: Lychee

description: smooth-skinned peach of the family Rosaceae. A genetic variant of common peaches
name: Nectarine

description: Passiflora edulis, commonly known as passion fruit, is a vine species of passion flower It is rich in antioxidants.
name: Passionfruit

description: edible fruit of a multitude of plant species in the genus Rubus of the rose family, most of which are in the subgenus Idaeobatus.
name: Raspberry

description: a type of orange, consisting of hybrids of mandarin orange varieties, with some pomelo contribution.
name: Tangerine

description: a fruit-bearing deciduous shrub in the family Lythraceae, subfamily Punicoideae, that grows between 5 and 10 m tall.
name: Pomegranate

description: Morus alba, known as white mulberry, common mulberry and silkworm mulberry, is a fast-growing, small to medium-sized mulberry tree which grows to 10–20 m tall.
name: Mulberry

description: a common tropical fruit amazingly rich in antioxidants, vitamin C, potassium, fiber and incredibly delicious.
name: Guava

description: Similar in taste to a sweet grapefruit, the pomelo is commonly consumed and used for festive occasions throughout Southeast Asia. Like the grapefruit, the pomelo has the potential for drug interactions.
name: Pomelo

description: a group of evergreen dwarf shrubs or trailing vines in the subgenus Oxycoccus of the genus Vaccinium.
name: Cranberry

description: the reddish edible fruit of an arborescent shrub (Cyphomandra betacea) of the nightshade family. that is native to South America but is grown commercially elsewhere; also : the shrub itself
name: Tamarillo

description: Passiflora tarminiana (or banana passionfruit) is a species of passionfruit. The yellow fruits are edible and their resemblance to small, straight bananas has given it the name banana passionfruit in some countries. It is native to the uplands of tropical South America and is now cultivated in many countries.
name: Curuba

description: : a small tropical American tree (Annona muricata) of the custard-apple family that has spicy odoriferous leaves; also : its large edible fruit that has fleshy spines and a slightly acid fibrous pulp
name: Soursop

description: Physalis peruviana, is a South American plant native to Peru, Ecuador and Colombia in the nightshade family (Solanaceae), commonly known as Cape gooseberry or goldenberry, known in their countries of origin as uchuva
name: Uchuva

description: The cantaloupe, rockmelon, sweet melon, or spanspek is a melon that is a variety of the muskmelon species from the family Cucurbitaceae
name: Melon Cantaloupe

description: any of various usually egg-shaped to football-shaped passion fruits (especially of Passiflora quadrangularis and P. edulis) that have juicy aromatic pulp
name: Granadilla

description: a large oval tasty but foul-smelling fruit with a prickly rind
name: Durian

description: A pitaya or pitahaya is the fruit of several different cactus species indigenous to the Americas. Pitaya usually refers to fruit of the genus Stenocereus, while pitahaya or dragon fruit refers to fruit of the genus Selenicereus, both in the family Cactaceae
name: Dragon Fruit

description: a pulpy fruit related to the lychee and produced by a southeast Asian evergreen tree (Euphoria longan syn. Dimocarpus longan) of the soapberry family
name: Longan

description: a bright red spiny Malayan fruit closely related to the lychee; also : a tree (Nephelium lappaceum) of the soapberry family that bears this fruit
name: Rambutan

description: crisp, yellow, 1-2" long fruit with the smell and taste of rose water. The rose apple is occasionally cultivated in the tropics but is rarely available in markets.
name: Rose Apple

description: They are round and approximately 2or4 inches. it's skin is smooth and leathery
name: Star Apple

description: it's a bean like pod filled with seed, has a harsh taste and surcy smell
name: Tamarind

description: it's a berry like fruit,that grow on a variety of tress with little sieze
name: perismon

description: The persimmon is the edible fruit of a number of species of trees in the genus Diospyros. The most widely cultivated of these is the Oriental persimmon, Diospyros kaki. Diospyros is in the family Ebenaceae, and a number of non-persimmon species of the genus are grown for ebony timber.
name: Mangosteen

description: Phyllanthus emblica, also known as emblic, emblic myrobalan, myrobalan, Indian gooseberry, from a ssnskirt
name: Amla

description: Cucumbers are popular long, lean, and green garden vegetables. they are fruits from thesame family of water melon
name: Cucumber

description: The brown onion or yellow onion is a variety of dry onion with a strong flavour. They have a greenish-white, light yellow, or white
name: Yellow Onion

description: A dry onion that has purplish red skins and white flesh that is tinged with red. they are medium to large
name: Red Onion

description: Garlic (Allium sativa ), is a plant with long, flat grasslike leaves and a papery hood around the flowers.
name: Garlic

description: is an edible, biennial herb in the family Apiaceae grown for its edible root. it produce a Rossetti leave of 7-132 leaves
name: Carrot

description: White cabbages (also called Dutch cabbages as they come from Holland) are actually a type of green cabbage which can have very pale-colored leaves. The sun usually turns the outer leaves pale green leaving white, tightly packed leaves in the center.
name: Cabbage

description: The radish is an edible root vegetable of the family Brassicaceae that was domesticated in Asia prior to Roman times. Radishes are grown and consumed throughout the world, being mostly eaten raw as a crunchy salad vegetable with a pungent flavor.
name: Radish

description: Eggplant, aubergine or brinjal is a plant species in the nightshade family Solanaceae. Solanum melongena is grown worldwide for its edible fruit. Most commonly purple, the spongy, absorbent fruit is used in several cuisines. Typically used as a vegetable in cooking, it is a berry by botanical definition.
name: Eggplant

description: A mushroom or toadstool is the fleshy, spore-bearing fruiting body of a fungus, typically produced above ground, on soil, or on its food source.
name: Mushroom

description: is a variety of a species of thistle cultivated as a food. The edible portion of the plant consists of the flower buds before the flowers come into bloom.
name: Artichoke

description: Is a cereal grain first domesticated by indigenous peoples in southern Mexico about 10,000 years ago. The leafy stalk of the plant produces pollen inflorescences and separate ovuliferous inflorescences called ears that yield kernels or seeds, which are fruits.
name: Corn

description: Broccoli is an edible green plant in the cabbage family whose large flowering head, stalk and small associated leaves are eaten as a vegetable. Broccoli is classified in the Italica cultivar group of the species Brassica oleracea.
name: Broccoli

description: Cauliflower is one of several vegetables in the species Brassica oleracea in the genus Brassica, which is in the Brassicaceae family. It is an annual plant that reproduces by seed. Typically, only the head is eaten – the edible white flesh sometimes called "curd".
name: Cauliflower

description: Celery is a marshland plant in the family Apiaceae that has been cultivated as a vegetable since antiquity. Celery has a long fibrous stalk tapering into leaves. Depending on location and cultivar, either its stalks, leaves or hypocotyl are eaten and used in cooking.
name: Celery

description: The chili pepper, from Nahuatl chīlli, is the berry-fruit of plants from the genus Capsicum which are members of the nightshade family, Solanaceae. Chili peppers are widely used in many cuisines as a spice to add pungent 'heat' to dishes.
name: Red Chili

description: is the berry-fruit of plants from the genus Capsicum which are members of the nightshade family, Solanaceae. Chili peppers are widely used in many cuisines as a spice to add pungent 'heat' to dishes.
name: Green Chili

description:
A tropical perennial American vine, Ipomoea batatas, having a fleshy tuber.
The tuber of this plant cooked as a vegetable.
name: Sweet Potato

description: a large, edible, orange-yellow fruit borne by a coarse, decumbent vine, Cucurbita pepo, of the gourd family.
name: Pumpkin

description: a cultivated plant, Lactuca sativa, occurring in many varieties and having succulent leaves used for salads.any species of Lactuca
name: Lettuce

description: pepper - a pungent, hot-tasting powder prepared from dried and ground peppercorns, commonly used as a spice or condiment to flavor food.
name: Pepper

description: squash - a state of being squeezed or forced into a small or restricted space
name: Squash

description: yam - the edible starchy tuber of a climbing plant, widely distributed in tropical and subtropical countries
name: Yam

description: The Brussels sprout is a member of the Gemmifera Group of cabbages (Brassica oleracea), grown for its edible buds.
name: Brussels Sprout

description: The tomato is the edible berry of the plant Solanum lycopersicum, commonly known as a tomato plant
name: Tomato

description: The potato is a starchy tuber of the plant Solanum tuberosum and is a root vegetable native to the Americas, with the plant itself being a perennial in the nightshade family Solanaceae.
name: Potato

description: The pea is most commonly the small spherical seed or the seed-pod of the pod fruit Pisum sativum
name: Pea

description: Spinach (Spinacia oleracea) is a leafy green vegetable that originated in Persia. It belongs to the amaranth family and is related to beets and quinoa.
name: Spinach

description: The beetroot is the taproot portion of a beet plant
name: Beetroot

description: The bell pepper is the fruit of plants in the Grossum cultivar group of the species Capsicum annuum. Cultivars of the plant produce fruits in different colors, including red, yellow, orange, green, white, and purple.
name: Bell Pepper

description: The leek is a vegetable, a cultivar of Allium ampeloprasum, the broadleaf wild leek. The edible part of the plant is a bundle of leaf sheaths that is sometimes erroneously called a stem or stalk
name: Leek

description: Ginger is a flowering plant whose rhizome, ginger root or ginger, is widely used as a spice and a folk medicine. It is a herbaceous perennial which grows annual pseudostems about one meter tall bearing narrow leaf blades
name: Ginger
